support_summary: TBK1 and TDP-43 are genetically and functionally linked in ALS. Loss-of-function mutations in TBK1 lead to the pathological accumulation of TDP-43 by impairing clearance pathways such as the endo-lysosomal and immunoproteasome systems. Conversely, TDP-43 can regulate TBK1 levels, indicating a bidirectional regulatory relationship.

functions.cellular_process: TBK1 is essential for maintaining cellular homeostasis of TDP-43, primarily by ensuring the proper function of the endo-lysosomal pathway. It is required for normal endosomal maturation and subsequent lysosomal acidification, which are critical for protein degradation and clearance.
functions.effect_description: Deficiency or loss-of-function mutations in TBK1 impair the endo-lysosomal pathway, leading to a disruption in TDP-43 clearance and resulting in the pathological accumulation of cytoplasmic, insoluble, and phosphorylated TDP-43.
biological_consequence: Loss of TBK1 function → Impaired endosomal maturation → Failure of lysosomal acidification → Defective protein clearance via endo-lysosomal pathway → Pathological accumulation of TDP-43 → Motor neuron degeneration
specific_effects: Loss-of-function mutations in TBK1 are sufficient to cause TDP-43 pathology in human-induced motor neurons. [18, 22]
The TDP-43 pathology resulting from TBK1 deficiency is driven more by dysfunctional endo-lysosomal pathways than by impaired autophagy. [18]
Restoring TBK1 levels can rescue endo-lysosomal function and restore TDP-43 homeostasis. [18, 22]
The relationship between TBK1, the endosomal pathway, and TDP-43 pathology is a key convergence point for ALS-FTD research. [6]

evidence.paper_title: Two FTD-ALS genes converge on the endosomal pathway to induce TDP-43 pathology and degeneration
evidence.authors: Shao W, Todd TW, Wu Y, Jones CY, Tong J, Jansen-West K, Daughrity L, Park J, Mitsuhashi Y, Funke A, Cannon A, DeTure M, Dickson DW, Petrucelli L, Cook C, Gendron TF
evidence.relevant_quote: Using mouse models of poly(GA) and reduced TBK1, they discovered that this relationship led to defective and enlarged endosomes and subsequent TDP43 pathology. [6]

mechanism: TBK1 is essential for maintaining cellular homeostasis of TDP-43, primarily by ensuring the proper f; TDP-43 can negatively regulate the innate immune signaling pathway by promoting the autophagic degra; TBK1 can promote the clearance of aggregation-prone TDP-43 through the innate immune system by induc
effect: Deficiency or loss-of-function mutations in TBK1 impair the endo-lysosomal pathway, leading to a disruption in TDP-43 clearance and resulting in the pathological accumulation of cytoplasmic, insoluble, and phosphorylated TDP-43.; By facilitating the degradation of TBK1, TDP-43 leads to reduced phosphorylation of TBK1 and its downstream targets, thereby suppressing the TBK1-mediated production of type I interferons and associated pro-inflammatory cytokines.; ...
summary: TDP43 regulates TBK1 to control multiple cellular processes including tdp-43 homeostasis, tbk1 degradation, and tdp-43 degradation (immunoproteasome), ultimately affecting motor neuron degeneration.

evidence.paper_title: Loss of TBK1 activity leads to TDP-43 proteinopathy through lysosomal dysfunction in human motor neurons
evidence.authors: Hao J, Wells MF, Niu G, San Juan IG, Limone F, Fukuda A, Leyton-Jaimes MF, Joseph B, Qian M, Mordes DA, Budnik B, Dou Z, Eggan K
evidence.assay: CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing, Immunocytochemistry, Western blot
evidence.relevant_quote: Here, we generated a human cellular model harboring loss-of-function mutations of TBK1 by gene editing and found that TBK1 deficiency was sufficient to cause TDP-43 pathology in human motor neurons. [18]

evidence.paper_title: Two FTD-ALS genes converge on the endosomal pathway to induce TDP-43 pathology and degeneration
evidence.authors: Shao W, Todd TW, Wu Y, Jones CY, Tong J, Jansen-West K, Daughrity L, Park J, Mitsuhashi Y, Funke A, Cannon A, DeTure M, Dickson DW, Petrucelli L, Cook C, Gendron TF
evidence.relevant_quote: Using mouse models of poly(GA) and reduced TBK1, they discovered that this relationship led to defective and enlarged endosomes and subsequent TDP43 pathology. [6]

evidence.paper_title: TDP43 negatively regulates TBK1-mediated IFN1 production through IRF7 pathway in neurodegenerative diseases
evidence.authors: Wang Y, Gao Y, Li Y, Wang L, Zhang T
evidence.relevant_quote: Our study reveals that TDP43 interacts with TBK1 and promotes its autophagic degradation, thereby inhibiting TBK1-IRF7 signaling and IFN1 production.

evidence.paper_title: TBK1 eliminates aggregation-prone monomeric TDP-43 through the IFNβ-immunoproteasome pathway
evidence.authors: Sakai S, Oiwa K, Iguchi Y, Watanabe S, Komine O, Horiuchi M, Katsuno M, Yamanaka K
evidence.relevant_quote: Here, we found that TBK1 alleviates TDP-43 pathology in neuronal cells via induction of interferon-beta (IFNβ)... We further demonstrated that IFNβ induces the immunoproteasome...promoting the degradation of aggregation-prone monomeric TDP-43. [8, 11]
